//imperial\n            tdWeather._currentItem.today_temp[0] = tdUtil.round(data.main.temp, 1);                                     //celsius\n            tdWeather._currentItem.today_temp[1] = tdWeather._celsiusToFahrenheit(data.main.temp);                      //imperial\n            tdWeather._currentItem.today_wind_speed[0] = tdUtil.round(data.wind.speed, 1);                              //metric\n            tdWeather._currentItem.today_wind_speed[1] = tdWeather._kmphToMph(data.wind.speed);                         //imperial\n\n            //console.log(tdWeather._currentItem);\n            //console.log(data);\n\n            // check the cache first and avoid doing the same ajax request again\n            if (tdLocalCache.exist(tdWeather._currentPositionCacheKey)) {\n                tdWeather._owmGetFiveDaysData(tdLocalCache.get(tdWeather._currentPositionCacheKey));\n            } else {\n                var weather = 'http://api.openweathermap.org/data/2.5/forecast/daily?lat=' + tdWeather._currentLatitude + '&lon=' + tdWeather._currentLongitude + '&units=metric&lang=' + tdWeather._currentItem.api_language + '&appid=' + tdWeather._currentItem.api_key;\n                jQuery.ajax({\n                    dataType: \"jsonp\",\n                    url: weather,\n                    success: tdWeather._owmGetFiveDaysData,\n                    cache:true\n                });\n            }\n\n        },\n\n\n        \n        _owmGetFiveDaysData: function (data) {\n            // save the data to localCache\n            tdLocalCache.set(tdWeather._currentPositionCacheKey, data);\n\n            // process the data\n            for (var item_index = 0; item_index < tdWeather._currentItem.forecast.length ; item_index++) {\n                var current_forecast = tdWeather._currentItem.forecast[item_index];\n                current_forecast.day_temp[0] = tdUtil.round(data.list[current_forecast.owm_day_index].temp.day);        //celsius\n                current_forecast.day_temp[1] = tdWeather._celsiusToFahrenheit(current_forecast.day_temp[0]);            //imperial\n            }\n            tdWeather._renderCurrentItem();\n        },\n\n\n        \n        _renderCurrentItem: function () {\n\n            //console.log('.' + tdWeather._currentItem.block_uid + ' .td-weather-city');\n\n            var blockInner = jQuery('#' + tdWeather._currentItem.block_uid);\n\n            // city\n            blockInner.find('.td-weather-city').html(tdWeather._currentItem.api_location);\n\n            // conditions\n            blockInner.find('.td-weather-condition').html(tdWeather._currentItem.today_icon_text);\n\n            // animation\n            // we remove all the classes! including the animation ones\n            var icon_el = blockInner.find('.td-w-today-icon');\n            icon_el.removeClass();\n            icon_el.addClass('td-w-today-icon');\n            icon_el.addClass(tdWeather._currentItem.today_icon);\n\n            var currentTempUnit = tdWeather._currentItem.current_unit;\n            var currentSpeedLabel = 'kmh';\n            var currentTempLabel = 'C';\n\n            // preapare the labels\n            if (currentTempUnit === 1) {\n                currentSpeedLabel = 'mph';\n                currentTempLabel = 'F';\n            }\n\n\n            // main temp\n            blockInner.find('.td-big-degrees').html(tdWeather._currentItem.today_temp[currentTempUnit]);\n\n            // main temp units\n            blockInner.find('.td-weather-unit').html(currentTempLabel);\n\n\n            // high\n            blockInner.find('.td-w-high-temp').html(tdWeather._currentItem.today_max[currentTempUnit]);\n\n            // low\n            blockInner.find('.td-w-low-temp').html(tdWeather._currentItem.today_min[currentTempUnit]);\n\n            // humidity\n            blockInner.find('.td-w-today-humidity').html(tdWeather._currentItem.today_humidity + '%');\n\n            // wind speed\n            blockInner.find('.td-w-today-wind-speed').html(tdWeather._currentItem.today_wind_speed[currentTempUnit] + currentSpeedLabel);\n\n            // clouds\n            blockInner.find('.td-w-today-clouds').html(tdWeather._currentItem.today_clouds + '%');\n\n            // full list of items! - just the temperature\n            for (var item_index = 0; item_index < tdWeather._currentItem.forecast.length ; item_index++) {\n                blockInner.find('.td-degrees-' + item_index).html(tdWeather._currentItem.forecast[item_index].day_temp[currentTempUnit]);\n            }\n\n\n            tdWeather._currentRequestInProgress = false; // allow other requests to take place\n        },\n\n\n        \n        _getItemByBlockID: function (block_uid) {\n            for (var item_index = 0; item_index < tdWeather.items.length; item_index++) {\n                if (tdWeather.items[item_index].block_uid === block_uid) {\n                    return tdWeather.items[item_index];\n                }\n            }\n            return false;\n        },\n\n\n        \n        _displayLocationApiError: function (error) {\n\n            if (error.code === 1) {\n                if (tdDetect.isAndroid) {\n                    alert('Please enable your gps and reload the page.');\n                    return;\n                }\n\n                else if (tdDetect.isIos) {\n                    alert(\"Please enable Location services for Safari Websites and reload the page. \\n ---------------------- \\nSettings > Privacy > Location Services\");\n                    return;\n                }\n\n\n                alert(\"Permission denied. Enable GPS or Location services and reload the page\");\n                return;\n\n            }\n\n            // the rest of the errors\n            var errors = {\n                2: 'Position unavailable',\n                3: 'Request timeout'\n            };\n            alert(\"Error: \" + errors[error.code]);\n        },\n\n\n        \n        _celsiusToFahrenheit: function (celsiusDegrees) {\n            var f_degrees = celsiusDegrees * 9 / 5 + 32;\n\n            var rounded_val = tdUtil.round(f_degrees, 1);\n            if (rounded_val > 99.9) {  // if the value is bigger than 100, round it\n                return tdUtil.round(f_degrees);\n            }\n\n            return rounded_val;\n        },\n\n        \n        _kmphToMph: function ($kmph) {\n            return tdUtil.round($kmph * 0.621371192, 1);\n        }\n\n    };  // end tdWeather\n})();\n\ntdWeather.init(); //init the class\n\n\n\n\njQuery( window ).load(function() {\n\n    'use strict';\n\n    jQuery( 'body' ).addClass( 'td-js-loaded' );\n\n    window.tdAnimationStack.init();\n});\n\njQuery( window ).ready(function() {\n\n    'use strict';\n\n    \n\n    jQuery( '.td_smart_list_1 a, .td_smart_list_3 a').click(function( event ) {\n        if ( event.target === event.currentTarget ) {\n            var targetAttributeContent = jQuery( this ).attr( 'target' );\n            var donwloadAttributeIsSet = jQuery( this )[0].hasAttribute( 'download' );\n            var currentUrl = jQuery( this ).attr( 'href' );\n            //if target is _blank open the link in a new window\n            if (donwloadAttributeIsSet) {\n                //link contains download attribute - do nothing, let it download\n            } else if (targetAttributeContent == '_blank') {\n                event.preventDefault();\n                window.open(currentUrl);\n            } else {\n            //regular links\n                if (( window.location.href !== currentUrl ) && tdUtil.isValidUrl(currentUrl)) {\n                    window.location.href = currentUrl;\n                }\n            }\n        }\n    });\n\n    //trending now\n    tdTrendingNowObject.tdTrendingNow();\n\n    //call to trending now function to start auto scroll\n    tdTrendingNowObject.tdTrendingNowAutoStart();\n});\n\n\n\n\n\nvar tdAnimationSprite = {};\n\n(function(){\n    'use strict';\n\n    tdAnimationSprite = {\n\n        items: [],\n\n        // flag used to not call requestAnimationFrame until the previous requestAnimationFrame callback runs\n        isInRequestAnimation: false,\n\n\n        // The item that needs animation\n        item: function item() {\n\n\n\n            // here we store the block Unique ID. This enables us to delete the item via this id @see tdPullDown.deleteItem\n            this.blockUid = '';\n\n            // boolean - an item must be initialized only once\n            this._isInitialized = false;\n\n            // boolean - an item can be paused and restarted\n            this.paused = false;\n\n            // boolean - the animation automatically starts at the computing item\n            this.automatStart = true;\n\n            // object - css properties that will be changed (key - value; ex: 'color' : '#00FFCC')\n            this.properties = [];\n\n            // boolean - flag used by the requestAnimationFrame callback to know which items have properties to apply\n            this.readyToAnimate = false;\n\n            // the index of the current frame\n            this.nextFrame = 1;\n\n            // number - the current interval id set for the animation\n            this.interval = undefined;\n\n            // the jquery obj whose background will be animated\n            this.jqueryObj = undefined;\n\n            // the css class selector of the jqueryObj\n            this.animationSpriteClass = undefined;\n\n            // string - default direction for parsing the sprite img\n            this._currentDirection = 'right';\n\n            // number - the executed loops\n            this._executedLoops = 0;\n\n\n            // string - css background position\n            this._prop_background_position = undefined;\n\n\n            // The followings will be set from the class selector\n\n            // int - number of frames (it must be greater than 1 to allow animation)\n            this.frames = undefined;\n\n            // the width(px) of a frame\n            this.frameWidth = undefined;\n\n            // int - the interval time (ms) the animation runs\n            this.velocity = undefined;\n\n            // boolean - to the right and vice versa\n            this.reverse = undefined;\n\n            // number - number of loops to animate\n            this.loops = undefined;\n\n\n            // Function actually compute the params for animation, prepare the params for next animation and calls t\n            // he requestAnimationFrame with a callback function to animate all items ready for animation\n            this.animate = function() {\n\n                this._prop_background_position = ( -1 * this.nextFrame * this.frameWidth ) + 'px 0';\n                this.readyToAnimate = true;\n\n\n                // The nextFrame value is computed for next frame\n                if ( true === this.reverse) {\n\n                    if ( 'right' === this._currentDirection ) {\n\n                        if ( this.nextFrame === this.frames - 1 ) {\n                            this._currentDirection = 'left';\n                            this.nextFrame--;\n                        } else {\n                            this.nextFrame++;\n                        }\n\n                    } else if ( 'left' === this._currentDirection ) {\n                        if ( 0 === this.nextFrame ) {\n\n                            this._currentDirection = 'right';\n                            this.nextFrame++;\n                            this._executedLoops++;\n\n                            if ( ( 0 !== this.loops ) && ( this._executedLoops === this.loops ) ) {\n                                clearInterval( this.interval );\n                            }\n                        } else {\n                            this.nextFrame--;\n                        }\n                    }\n\n                } else {\n\n                    if ( this.nextFrame === this.frames - 1 ) {\n\n                        this._executedLoops++;\n\n                        // complete tour ( once to the right ), so we stop\n                        if ( ( 0 !== this.loops ) && ( this._executedLoops === this.loops ) ) {\n                            clearInterval( this.interval );\n                        }\n\n                        this.nextFrame = 0;\n                    } else {\n                        this.nextFrame++;\n                    }\n                }\n\n\n                //this.jqueryObj.css('background-position', horizontalPosition + 'px 0');\n\n                // Any calls to requestAnimationFrame are stopped. Anyway, the settings of the current item are ready,\n                // so the callback will consider it.\n                if ( false === tdAnimationSprite.isInRequestAnimation ) {\n                    tdAnimationSprite.isInRequestAnimation = true;\n                    window.requestAnimationFrame( tdAnimationSprite.animateAllItems );\n                }\n            };\n        },\n\n        \n        _initializeItem: function( item ) {\n            if ( ( true === item._isInitialized ) ) {\n                return;\n            }\n\n            // get all strings containing 'td_animation_sprite'\n            var regex = /(td_animation_sprite\\S*)/gi;\n\n            // resultMatch is an array of matches, or null if there's no matching\n            var resultMatch = item.jqueryObj.attr( 'class' ).match( regex );\n\n            if ( null !== resultMatch ) {\n\n                item.offsetTop = item.jqueryObj.offset().top;\n                item.offsetBottomToTop = item.offsetTop + item.jqueryObj.height();\n\n                // the last matching is considered, because new css classes that matches, can be added before recomputing an item\n                item.animationSpriteClass = resultMatch[ resultMatch.length - 1 ];\n\n                var sceneParams = item.animationSpriteClass.split( '-' );\n\n                if ( 7 === sceneParams.length ) {\n\n                    item.frames = parseInt( sceneParams[1] );\n                    item.frameWidth = parseInt( sceneParams[2] );\n                    item.velocity = parseInt( sceneParams[3] );\n                    item.loops = parseInt( sceneParams[4] );\n\n                    if ( 1 === parseInt( sceneParams[5] ) ) {\n                        item.reverse = true;\n                    } else {\n                        item.reverse = false;\n                    }\n\n                    if ( 1 === parseInt( sceneParams[6] ) ) {\n                        item.automatStart = true;\n                    } else {\n                        item.automatStart = false;\n                    }\n\n                    item._isInitialized = true;\n                }\n            }\n        },\n\n\n\n        addItem: function( item ) {\n\n            if ( item.constructor === tdAnimationSprite.item ) {\n                tdAnimationSprite.items.push( item );\n                tdAnimationSprite._initializeItem( item );\n\n                if ( true === item.automatStart ) {\n                    tdAnimationSprite.computeItem( item );\n                }\n            }\n        },\n\n\n        \n        deleteItem: function(blockUid) {\n            for (var cnt = 0; cnt < tdAnimationSprite.items.length; cnt++) {\n                if (tdAnimationSprite.items[cnt].blockUid === blockUid) {\n                    tdAnimationSprite.items.splice(cnt, 1); // remove the item from the \"array\"\n                    return true;\n                }\n            }\n            return false;\n        },\n\n        computeItem: function( item ) {\n\n            // set interval just for frames greater than 1\n            if ( item.frames > 1 ) {\n\n                // Check the item interval to not be set\n                if ( undefined !== item.interval ) {\n                    return;\n                }\n\n                item.interval = setInterval(function(){\n\n                    if ( false === item.paused ) {\n                        item.animate();\n                    }\n\n                }, item.velocity );\n            }\n        },\n\n        // At recomputing, an item will check again its last css class selector and it is reinitialized. So, if a new\n        // css class selector is added, it will use it. This way the animation can be modified\n        recomputeItem: function( item ) {\n\n            // stop any animation\n            clearInterval( item.interval );\n\n            // reset the item interval\n            item.interval = undefined;\n\n            // reset the _isInitialized flag\n            item._isInitialized = false;\n\n            // reinitialize item\n            tdAnimationSprite._initializeItem( item );\n\n            // compute the item again\n            tdAnimationSprite.computeItem( item );\n        },\n\n        // Clear the interval set for an item.\n        stopItem: function( item ) {\n            if ( ( item.constructor === tdAnimationSprite.item ) && ( true === item._isInitialized ) ) {\n                clearInterval( item.interval );\n\n                // reset the item interval\n                item.interval = undefined;\n            }\n        },\n\n        // Start animation of a paused item\n        startItem: function( item ) {\n            if ( ( item.constructor === tdAnimationSprite.item ) && ( true === item._isInitialized ) ) {\n                item.paused = false;\n            }\n        },\n\n        // Pause animation of an item\n        pauseItem: function( item ) {\n            if ( ( item.constructor === tdAnimationSprite.item ) && ( true === item._isInitialized ) ) {\n                item.paused = true;\n            }\n        },\n\n\n\n\n        computeAllItems: function() {\n            for ( var i = 0; i < tdAnimationSprite.items.length; i++ ) {\n                tdAnimationSprite.computeItem( tdAnimationSprite.items[i] );\n            }\n        },\n\n        recomputeAllItems: function() {\n            for ( var i = 0; i < tdAnimationSprite.items.length; i++ ) {\n                tdAnimationSprite.recomputeItem( tdAnimationSprite.items[i] );\n            }\n        },\n\n        stopAllItems: function() {\n            for ( var i = 0; i < tdAnimationSprite.items.length; i++ ) {\n                tdAnimationSprite.stopItem( tdAnimationSprite.items[i] );\n            }\n        },\n\n        pauseAllItems: function() {\n            for ( var i = 0; i < tdAnimationSprite.items.length; i++ ) {\n                tdAnimationSprite.pauseItem( tdAnimationSprite.items[i] );\n            }\n        },\n\n        startAllItems: function() {\n            for ( var i = 0; i < tdAnimationSprite.items.length; i++ ) {\n                tdAnimationSprite.startItem( tdAnimationSprite.items[i] );\n            }\n        },\n\n\n        // The requestAnimationFrame callback function.\n        // The 'background-position' is set and then the 'readyToAnimate' flag is set to false\n        animateAllItems: function() {\n            var currentItem;\n\n            for ( var i = 0; i < tdAnimationSprite.items.length; i++ ) {\n                currentItem = tdAnimationSprite.items[i];\n                if ( true === currentItem.readyToAnimate ) {\n                    currentItem.jqueryObj.css( 'background-position', currentItem._prop_background_position );\n                    currentItem.readyToAnimate = false;\n                }\n            }\n            tdAnimationSprite.isInRequestAnimation = false;\n        }\n    };\n\n    \n\n    var tdAnimationSpriteElements = jQuery( 'span[class^=\"td_animation_sprite\"]' );\n\n    for ( var i = 0; i < tdAnimationSpriteElements.length; i++ ) {\n        var tdAnimationSpriteItem = new tdAnimationSprite.item();\n\n\n        tdAnimationSpriteItem.jqueryObj = jQuery( tdAnimationSpriteElements[i] );\n        tdAnimationSpriteItem.blockUid = tdAnimationSpriteItem.jqueryObj.data('td-block-uid');   // the block uid is used on the front end editor when we want to delete this item via it's blockuid\n        tdAnimationSprite.addItem( tdAnimationSpriteItem );\n    }\n})();\n\nfunction td_date_i18n(format, timestamp) {\n    // http://kevin.vanzonneveld.net\n    // +   original by: Carlos R. L. Rodrigues (http://www.jsfromhell.com)\n    // +      parts by: Peter-Paul Koch (http://www.quirksmode.org/js/beat.html)\n    // +   improved by: Kevin van Zonneveld (http://kevin.vanzonneveld.net)\n    // +   improved by: MeEtc (http://yass.meetcweb.com)\n    // +   improved by: Brad Touesnard\n    // +   improved by: Tim Wiel\n    // +   improved by: Bryan Elliott\n    // +   improved by: David Randall\n    // +      input by: Brett Zamir (http://brett-zamir.me)\n    // +   bugfixed by: Kevin van Zonneveld (http://kevin.vanzonneveld.net)\n    // +   improved by: Theriault\n    // +  derived from: gettimeofday\n    // +      input by: majak\n    // +   bugfixed by: majak\n    // +   bugfixed by: Kevin van Zonneveld (http://kevin.vanzonneveld.net)\n    // +      input by: Alex\n    // +   bugfixed by: Brett Zamir (http://brett-zamir.me)\n    // +   improved by: Theriault\n    // +   improved by: Brett Zamir (http://brett-zamir.me)\n    // +   improved by: Theriault\n    // +   improved by: Thomas Beaucourt (http://www.webapp.fr)\n    // +   improved by: JT\n    // +   improved by: Theriault\n    // +   improved by: Rafał Kukawski (http://blog.kukawski.pl)\n    // +   bugfixed by: omid (http://phpjs.org/functions/380:380#comment_137122)\n    // +      input by: Martin\n    // +      input by: Alex Wilson\n    // +      input by: Haravikk\n    // +   improved by: Theriault\n    // +   bugfixed by: Chris (http://www.devotis.nl/)\n    // +   improved by: Jari Pennanen (https://github.com/ciantic/) - date_i18n from WordPress\n    // %        note 1: Uses global: php_js to store the default timezone\n    // %        note 2: Although the function potentially allows timezone info (see notes), it currently does not set\n    // %        note 2: per a timezone specified by date_default_timezone_set(). Implementers might use\n    // %        note 2: this.php_js.currentTimezoneOffset and this.php_js.currentTimezoneDST set by that function\n    // %        note 2: in order to adjust the dates in this function (or our other date functions!) accordingly\n    // *     example 1: date('H:m:s \\\\m \\\\i\\\\s \\\\m\\\\o\\\\n\\\\t\\\\h', 1062402400);\n    // *     returns 1: '09:09:40 m is month'\n    // *     example 2: date('F j, Y, g:i a', 1062462400);\n    // *     returns 2: 'September 2, 2003, 2:26 am'\n    // *     example 3: date('Y W o', 1062462400);\n    // *     returns 3: '2003 36 2003'\n    // *     example 4: x = date('Y m d', (new Date()).getTime()/1000);\n    // *     example 4: (x+'').length == 10 // 2009 01 09\n    // *     returns 4: true\n    // *     example 5: date('W', 1104534000);\n    // *     returns 5: '53'\n    // *     example 6: date('B t', 1104534000);\n    // *     returns 6: '999 31'\n    // *     example 7: date('W U', 1293750000.82); // 2010-12-31\n    // *     returns 7: '52 1293750000'\n    // *     example 8: date('W', 1293836400); // 2011-01-01\n    // *     returns 8: '52'\n    // *     example 9: date('W Y-m-d', 1293974054); // 2011-01-02\n    // *     returns 9: '52 2011-01-02'\n    var that = this,\n        jsdate,\n        f,\n    // Keep this here (works, but for code commented-out\n    // below for file size reasons)\n    //, tal= [],\n    // trailing backslash -> (dropped)\n    // a backslash followed by any character (including backslash) -> the character\n    // empty string -> empty string\n        formatChr = /\\\\?(.?)/gi,\n        formatChrCb = function (t, s) {\n            return f[t] ? f[t]() : s;\n        },\n        _pad = function (n, c) {\n            n = String(n);\n            while (n.length < c) {\n                n = '0' + n;\n            }\n            return n;\n        };\n    f = {\n        // Day\n        d: function () { // Day of month w/leading 0; 01..31\n            return _pad(f.j(), 2);\n        },\n        D: function () { // Shorthand day name; Mon...Sun\n            return tdDateNamesI18n.day_names_short[f.w()];\n        },\n        j: function () { // Day of month; 1..31\n            return jsdate.getDate();\n        },\n        l: function () { // Full day name; Monday...Sunday\n            return tdDateNamesI18n.day_names[f.w()];\n        },\n        N: function () { // ISO-8601 day of week; 1[Mon]..7[Sun]\n            return f.w() || 7;\n        },\n        S: function(){ // Ordinal suffix for day of month; st, nd, rd, th\n            var j = f.j(),\n                i = j%10;\n            if (i <= 3 && parseInt((j%100)/10, 10) == 1) {\n                i = 0;\n            }\n            return ['st', 'nd', 'rd'][i - 1] || 'th';\n        },\n        w: function () { // Day of week; 0[Sun]..6[Sat]\n            return jsdate.getDay();\n        },\n        z: function () { // Day of year; 0..365\n            var a = new Date(f.Y(), f.n() - 1, f.j()),\n                b = new Date(f.Y(), 0, 1);\n            return Math.round((a - b) / 864e5);\n        },\n\n        // Week\n        W: function () { // ISO-8601 week number\n            var a = new Date(f.Y(), f.n() - 1, f.j() - f.N() + 3),\n                b = new Date(a.getFullYear(), 0, 4);\n            return _pad(1 + Math.round((a - b) / 864e5 / 7), 2);\n        },\n\n        // Month\n        F: function () { // Full month name; January...December\n            return tdDateNamesI18n.month_names[f.n() - 1];\n        },\n        m: function () { // Month w/leading 0; 01...12\n            return _pad(f.n(), 2);\n        },\n        M: function () { // Shorthand month name; Jan...Dec\n            return tdDateNamesI18n.month_names_short[f.n() - 1];\n        },\n        n: function () { // Month; 1...12\n            return jsdate.getMonth() + 1;\n        },\n        t: function () { // Days in month; 28...31\n            return (new Date(f.Y(), f.n(), 0)).getDate();\n        },\n\n        // Year\n        L: function () { // Is leap year?; 0 or 1\n            var j = f.Y();\n            return j % 4 === 0 & j % 100 !== 0 | j % 400 === 0;\n        },\n        o: function () { // ISO-8601 year\n            var n = f.n(),\n                W = f.W(),\n                Y = f.Y();\n            return Y + (n === 12 && W < 9 ? 1 : n === 1 && W > 9 ? -1 : 0);\n        },\n        Y: function () { // Full year; e.g. 1980...2010\n            return jsdate.getFullYear();\n        },\n        y: function () { // Last two digits of year; 00...99\n            return f.Y().toString().slice(-2);\n        },\n\n        // Time\n        a: function () { // am or pm\n            return jsdate.getHours() > 11 ? \"pm\" : \"am\";\n        },\n        A: function () { // AM or PM\n            return f.a().toUpperCase();\n        },\n        B: function () { // Swatch Internet time; 000..999\n            var H = jsdate.getUTCHours() * 36e2,\n            // Hours\n                i = jsdate.getUTCMinutes() * 60,\n            // Minutes\n                s = jsdate.getUTCSeconds(); // Seconds\n            return _pad(Math.floor((H + i + s + 36e2) / 86.4) % 1e3, 3);\n        },\n        g: function () { // 12-Hours; 1..12\n            return f.G() % 12 || 12;\n        },\n        G: function () { // 24-Hours; 0..23\n            return jsdate.getHours();\n        },\n        h: function () { // 12-Hours w/leading 0; 01..12\n            return _pad(f.g(), 2);\n        },\n        H: function () { // 24-Hours w/leading 0; 00..23\n            return _pad(f.G(), 2);\n        },\n        i: function () { // Minutes w/leading 0; 00..59\n            return _pad(jsdate.getMinutes(), 2);\n        },\n        s: function () { // Seconds w/leading 0; 00..59\n            return _pad(jsdate.getSeconds(), 2);\n        },\n        u: function () { // Microseconds; 000000-999000\n            return _pad(jsdate.getMilliseconds() * 1000, 6);\n        },\n\n        // Timezone\n        e: function () { // Timezone identifier; e.g. Atlantic/Azores, ...\n            // The following works, but requires inclusion of the very large\n            // timezone_abbreviations_list() function.\n            \n            throw 'Not supported (see source code of date() for timezone on how to add support)';\n        },\n        I: function () { // DST observed?; 0 or 1\n            // Compares Jan 1 minus Jan 1 UTC to Jul 1 minus Jul 1 UTC.\n            // If they are not equal, then DST is observed.\n            var a = new Date(f.Y(), 0),\n            // Jan 1\n                c = Date.UTC(f.Y(), 0),\n            // Jan 1 UTC\n                b = new Date(f.Y(), 6),\n            // Jul 1\n                d = Date.UTC(f.Y(), 6); // Jul 1 UTC\n            return ((a - c) !== (b - d)) ? 1 : 0;\n        },\n        O: function () { // Difference to GMT in hour format; e.g. +0200\n            var tzo = jsdate.getTimezoneOffset(),\n                a = Math.abs(tzo);\n            return (tzo > 0 ? \"-\" : \"+\") + _pad(Math.floor(a / 60) * 100 + a % 60, 4);\n        },\n        P: function () { // Difference to GMT w/colon; e.g. +02:00\n            var O = f.O();\n            return (O.substr(0, 3) + \":\" + O.substr(3, 2));\n        },\n        T: function () { // Timezone abbreviation; e.g. EST, MDT, ...\n            // The following works, but requires inclusion of the very\n            // large timezone_abbreviations_list() function.\n            \n            return 'UTC';\n        },\n        Z: function () { // Timezone offset in seconds (-43200...50400)\n            return -jsdate.getTimezoneOffset() * 60;\n        },\n\n        // Full Date/Time\n        c: function () { // ISO-8601 date.\n            return 'Y-m-d\\\\TH:i:sP'.replace(formatChr, formatChrCb);\n        },\n        r: function () { // RFC 2822\n            return 'D, d M Y H:i:s O'.replace(formatChr, formatChrCb);\n        },\n        U: function () { // Seconds since UNIX epoch\n            return jsdate / 1000 | 0;\n        }\n    };\n    this.date = function (format, timestamp) {\n        that = this;\n        jsdate = (timestamp === undefined ? new Date() : // Not provided\n            (timestamp instanceof Date) ? new Date(timestamp) : // JS Date()\n                new Date(timestamp * 1000) // UNIX timestamp (auto-convert to int)\n        );\n        return format.replace(formatChr, formatChrCb);\n    };\n    return this.date(format, timestamp);\n}\njQuery(document).ready(function(){\n\tjQuery('#td-top-mobile-toggle a, .td-header-search-button-mob').bind('click', function(e){\n\t\te.preventDefault();\n\t});\n\t\n\tjQuery('.sd_header_sticky_ad .tpd-close-btn').bind('click', function(e){\n\t\te.preventDefault();\n\t\tjQuery('.sd_header_sticky_ad' ).hide();\n\t});\n\n\t\n});\n\n</script>\n\n\t\t\t\n\n\n\n<div id=\"fb-root\" class=\" fb_reset\"><div style=\"position: absolute; top: -10000px; height: 0px; width: 0px;\"><div><iframe name=\"fb_xdm_frame_http\" frameborder=\"0\" allowtransparency=\"true\" allowfullscreen=\"true\" scrolling=\"no\" id=\"fb_xdm_frame_http\" aria-hidden=\"true\" title=\"Facebook Cross Domain Communication Frame\" tabindex=\"-1\" src=\"http://staticxx.facebook.com/connect/xd_arbiter/r/96nq-xsaNcg.js?version=42#channel=f296213dc7b974&amp;origin=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.scrapdigest.com\" style=\"border: none;\"></iframe><iframe name=\"fb_xdm_frame_https\" frameborder=\"0\" allowtransparency=\"true\" allowfullscreen=\"true\" scrolling=\"no\" id=\"fb_xdm_frame_https\" aria-hidden=\"true\" title=\"Facebook Cross Domain Communication Frame\" tabindex=\"-1\" src=\"https://staticxx.facebook.com/connect/xd_arbiter/r/96nq-xsaNcg.js?version=42#channel=f296213dc7b974&amp;origin=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.scrapdigest.com\" style=\"border: none;\"></iframe></div></div><div style=\"position: absolute; top: -10000px; height: 0px; width: 0px;\"><div></div></div></div><script type=\"text/javascript\" src=\"//z.moatads.com/nativonielsen548znrb18/moatcontent.js?moatClientLevel1=12341\"></script><img width=\"4\" height=\"4\" id=\"moat7530711000000\" style=\"display: none;\"></body>"}
